column4: What's a good monitor system for looking for attacks? While having a text file open I saw %systemroot%/cmd.exe and some command be written to it on it's own and kind of curious on how I can figure out how that happened.
you need to install ubuntu
I am running xubuntu - that's why I'm not too worried
I just want to know where it came from
how did you see it?
did you see it while on windoze?
I was coding in Code::Blocks and it just started typing to my screen. No I don't run windows on any of my machines not even in a vm.
are you on a badlan?
what would be a badlan?
a lan in which your "mates" play tricks on you

ahhh not that I'm aware of - it's an office and the only other tech savy person is my boss and he isn't in the office - I do have ssh and vnc ports forwarded to my machine - ssh is a non standard port
add a vnc password
or make it so that people have to ask you to let them on
Pretty sure it requires a password
it is almost certainly a vnc hack (sounds like)
That's what I was thinking - I disabled port forwarding for now. I just use it to work from home sometimes
ok
Is there anyway to monitor attacks like that or any attacks in general?
yes... if you make vnc request your permission; then drop down to permit after 10 seconds
so if no-one is using it you can still vnc in
but if you are using it you can stop l33t l$x0rs
lol,
